intro: Aulostemon mzimvubuensis, commonly known as the Mzimvubu aster, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white and yellow. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Aulostemon mzimvubuensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
